title: Business Development Manager
keyResponsibilities: Develop and maintain relationships with potential clients from various industries.
Organize meetings, presentations, and persuade clients about the company's products and services.
Build and maintain a database of potential and existing clients.
Advise and support clients in selecting the most suitable advertising solutions.
Plan and implement marketing and business strategies to increase sales revenue.
Monitor and evaluate business performance, propose measures to improve efficiency.
Participate in negotiating contracts and cooperation terms with clients.
jobRequirements: Experience: 3 to 5 years in equivalent positions at advertising companies, advertising production, or creative agencies.
Sales Revenue: Achieve sales targets as set.
New Customer Information Search: Gather information and create lists of new potential customers.
New Customer Meetings: Number of face-to-face meetings to introduce products and services.
Bidding, Project Quoting: Number of proposed projects and quotations sent.
Degree: Bachelor's or equivalent in business, marketing, or advertising.
Excellent communication and persuasion skills.
Strong organizational, planning, and time management skills.
Willingness and ability to work independently and in teams.
Understanding of the advertising market and consumer trends is an advantage.
benefits: Salary: 16,000,000 VND/month.
Project commission: 5% of the total project value. Exceeding KPIs will receive an additional 1.5% multiplied by the committed sales revenue in KPI.
Professional and dynamic working environment.
Opportunities for career advancement and development.
additionalBenefits: Able to recruit up to 2 Business Development Executives, eligible for commission on the revenue brought in by the entire team (0.5%).

title: Accountant
keyResponsibilities: Monitor daily company income and expenses.
Process invoices, receipts, and vouchers for entry into the accounting system.
Assist in preparing monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reports.
Prepare and submit monthly, quarterly, and annual tax reports to tax authorities.
Support in maintaining and updating accounting records, ledgers, and files.
Calculate and process employee salaries and social insurance.
Collect and record information on daily financial transactions, including income, expenses, and other transactions.
Monitor accounts receivable and report on outstanding balances.
Track sales figures for the sales department.
Provide necessary data and information for management analysis and reporting.
jobRequirements: Years of Experience: 1 year or more. Preference given to candidates with experience in accounting service companies.
Career Goal: Passion for Accounting, committed to long-term engagement.
Bachelor's degree in Accounting or Finance.
Experience in accounting field preferred, especially in the advertising industry.
Attention to detail, accuracy, responsibility.
benefits: Salary negotiable based on workload.
Negotiated salary level based on experience.
Full participation in social insurance, holiday bonuses, Tet bonuses, year-end bonuses.
Probationary period: 2 months (85% salary).
Salary increase and bonuses based on performance and workload.
Dynamic, supportive work environment with mutual assistance.

Perform administrative work (answering phones, paperwork etc.).

Knowledge of terminology will be appreciated.
Computer savvy.
Excellent organizational and multi-tasking ability.
Resourcefulness and problem-solving.
A team player with great communication skills
Physical strength and stamina
A valid driver's license
High school diploma; Relevant training (e.g. production courses) will be an advantage
benefits: Negotiated salary level based on experience.
Work on increasingly challenging and engaging real-world projects.
Great mentorship and the opportunity to develop your skills.
Work closely with a mentor who has almost 10 years of experience in the field.
Competitive internship stipend or hourly wage based on qualifications and experience.
Reimbursement or subsidy for relevant job-related expenses such as commuting costs or professional development courses.
Opportunity for performance-based incentives or bonuses.
Access to company resources and networking opportunities to enhance professional growth and development.
Stipend travel/lunch.
